Description: Limestone figure of bird with hinging head. Possibly from a toy. Joint showing at the neck Head fragment. Crudely carved from soft Egyptian (?) limestone.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), Level 420 just south of the scarab factory
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Bird figures in stone were rare at Naukratis. Two examples with movable heads (Cairo TR14/9/18/11; Edinburgh A.1886.518.6 I; Petrie 1886, 22, 40) were possibly toys, whilst a single flat bird figure with a fixed head (Boston 86.164) is of uncertain function or context. Described by Petrie 'together with rude stone figures of birds with hinging heads, the heads now lost and only the joint showing at the neck' (Petrie 1886, 22). Similar to pieces dated 6th to 4th century BC by Petrie (Petrie 1886, 40, Pl.19.1&3, who discusses limestone bird figurines on page 40), and pieces found in 5th century BC well deposits by Hogarth Hogarth 1905, 122, 125; Hogarth 1903 Diary April 24th and 25th, well 2 bottom).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CE.205) (Phase 3)
